dialog.text: Shadow… can I ask you something? I'm scared of what I'll find if I look.
dialog.instructions: Hesitant, breathy whisper; boyish, slow; vulnerability at the start.

dialog.text: Ask. Courage often begins as a quiet question in the dark.
dialog.instructions: Calm, steady, warm; low tone with patient pause between phrases.

dialog.text: Why do you show up as anger, shame, the parts I hide?
dialog.instructions: Trembling, soft, rising emotion; unsure but honest.

dialog.text: Because once you needed to hide to survive. I kept what you couldn't hold then — not to punish you, but to protect a fragile you.
dialog.instructions: Gentle, compassionate; slight sadness like a parent remembering hard times.

dialog.text: So all this time I've been fighting the thing that was trying to keep me safe?
dialog.instructions: Small, confused, a childlike ache in the voice.

dialog.text: Yes. When we push parts away we make them louder. The shadow speaks in extremes because it wants to be heard.
dialog.instructions: Clear, explanatory, soft encouragement; steady cadence.

dialog.text: What if I look and don't like what I see?
dialog.instructions: Quick inhale, fear edged with curiosity; quieter.

dialog.text: Then look kindly. Name the memory, the fear, the promise you made. Naming drains the mystery that feeds shame.
dialog.instructions: Warm, encouraging; gentle instruction with intentional pauses.

dialog.text: I remember hiding a mistake from Mom and promising I'd be perfect. I learned to be small to avoid being seen.
dialog.instructions: Small voice, fragile, almost childlike confession.

dialog.text: There — the story. That promise once helped you cope. It no longer needs to run your life. When you bring light and compassion, the armor loosens.
dialog.instructions: Reassuring, luminous; voice like a steady lighthouse beam.

dialog.text: How do I do that without disappearing? I'm scared I'll lose who I am.
dialog.instructions: Fearful but seeking; quicker tempo, earnest.

dialog.text: Integration doesn't erase you. It enlarges you. You keep everything that serves and transform what was only a defense into wisdom.
dialog.instructions: Assuring, firm yet tender; inspirational warmth.

dialog.text: So the courage is… to ask? To keep asking even when I'm afraid?
dialog.instructions: Slow realization, a hopeful tremor in the voice.

dialog.text: Exactly. Ask. Listen. Breathe. Thank the parts that guarded you and invite them home. The hero's journey is inside you — a return, not a conquest.
dialog.instructions: Soft crescendo to uplift; calm, resonant, almost whispering revelation.

dialog.text: I think I can start with one brave question tonight. Maybe that's enough to begin coming home.
dialog.instructions: Quiet relief and gentle resolve; a small smile heard in the voice.

dialog.text: Begin there. And if this moved you, pause now: ask yourself one brave question, sit with the answer, and share what you find in the comments — your courage could light the way for someone else.
dialog.instructions: Inviting, warm call to action; encouraging, steady closing tone.
